thread.title: Import duty on wheat raised

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Import duty on wheat raised
text:
Tribune News Service
New Delhi, October 19
To protect the domestic market and restrict overseas purchases in the view of falling global prices, the government today raised import duty on wheat to 25 per cent till March next year "In view of the continued fall in international prices of wheat and the anticipated adverse impact of increased imports during the first half of this financial year, basic customs duty on wheat has been increased from 10 per cent to 25 per cent for a period up to March 31, 2016," a statement issued by the Finance Ministry today said. Notably the government had imposed a 10 per cent import duty on wheat, for the first time since 2006, in August after private flour millers started importing high-protein stocks from Australia despite surplus stocks of other varieties of wheat with the FCI-the nodal agency for foodgrain procurement and distribution in the country. According to officials, the Agriculture Ministry was also in favour of the hike as overseas buying sends a wrong signal on local prices and is also detrimental for the local markets and farmers' sentiments. State-owned Food Corporation of India (FCI) procured 28.08 million tonnes of wheat in 2014-15 crop year (July- June), of which 26.62 million tonnes were purchased under the relaxed quality norms due to the crop damage because of untimely rains and hail storm.
